meaningMnemonic: You already learned that 漬ける means "to pickle something," so if you add that to the end of a food word (and leave off the る) it means that food has been <vocabulary>pickled in</vocabulary> something, like  酢漬け  (pickled in vinegar).
readingMnemonic: You've already learned 漬ける (to pickle something), so just take the る off and you've pickled whatever comes before 〜漬け. Easy peasy.
